steps.title: A body scrub will remove dry, dead skin cells.
steps.content: A body scrub will remove dry, dead skin cells. Hop in the shower for a few minutes first, so you aren’t applying the scrub to dry skin. [1] X Research source Everyone’s skin is a little different, so rub a small amount of product on your skin to make sure you don’t have a reaction. [2] X Research source Feel free to focus on rougher, dryer sections of skin, like your knees and heels, or apply the scrub all over. [3] X Research source Don’t worry—it’s perfectly safe to both dry brush and use a body scrub. Always exfoliate before you shave, so all your dead skin cells are cleared away.

steps.title: Dry brushing
steps.content: Dry brushing both exfoliates and stimulates your legs. [4] X Research source Grab a natural-bristle brush and guide in gentle, upward strokes around your knees, thighs, calves, and butt. Dry brushing both legs is quick and easy, and only takes about 3 minutes total. [5] X Research source Feel free to dry brush every day, but do it before you hop into the shower; this way, all your dead skin cells will get rinsed off. [6] X Research source Some people claim that dry brushing reduces cellulite, but there isn’t any hard evidence to prove this. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Some body washes actually strip away oil.
steps.content: Some body washes actually strip away oil. To keep your skin smooth and sleek, pick out a creamy, nourishing body wash formula instead. If you’re a fan of bar soap, opt for a glycerin-based product infused with Argan, almond, or coconut oil. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Shave your legs while taking a warm bath or shower.
steps.content: Shave your legs while taking a warm bath or shower. [9] X Research source Slather a shaving gel or cream all over your legs, so the razor glides really smoothly over your skin. Then, grab a sharp razor, shaving your legs in the direction of your leg hair growth. [10] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Once you’re finished, rinse off your legs with cool water and apply moisturizer all over your skin. [11] X Research source Keep your razor in a dry, clean spot when you’re not using it, and replace your blade every 5-7 shaves, if possible. If you aren’t a fan of shaving, you might prefer a depilatory (hair-removing) cream. [12] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Moisture leaves your skin right after you step out of the shower.
steps.content: Moisture leaves your skin right after you step out of the shower. [13] X Research source With this in mind, spread a thick layer of moisturizing lotion all over your legs right away. Then, wait at least 10 minutes for the product to soak into your skin. [14] X Research source For the best results, apply your lotion within 3 minutes of leaving the shower. If you’d like your skin to look more youthful, pick out a lotion with retinols. [15] X Research source

steps.title: The body oil goes on top of your lotion.
steps.content: The body oil goes on top of your lotion. Before turning in for the night, spread a thin layer of body oil on top of the lotion. The oil helps “protect” the lotion, which keeps your legs moisturized throughout the night. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Humidifiers
steps.content: Humidifiers are an easy fix for dry skin. If the air in your home is really dry, your skin might be paying the price. Set up a humidifier somewhere in your home, which will improve the air’s moisture content overall. [17] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Experts recommend keeping your home’s humidity somewhere around 30-50%. [18] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You can find humidifiers at big-name retailers, home goods stores, and online marketplaces.

steps.title: Lots of sunlight can take a toll on your legs.
steps.content: Lots of sunlight can take a toll on your legs. To be safe, apply an even layer of moisturizing sunscreen all over your legs before heading outside. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Dehydration can lead to dry, tight skin.
steps.content: Dehydration can lead to dry, tight skin. To prevent this, try drinking 8 glasses of water each day. While you won’t see results overnight, drinking more water may help improve your skin in the long run. [20] X Trustworthy Source University of Wisconsin Health Integrated healthcare system of the University of Wisconsin focused on treating and providing support to patients and public health initiatives Go to source

steps.title: Waxing
steps.content: Waxing lasts longer than traditional shaving. Spread a layer of wax along a small portion of your legs. Then, press a cloth strip on top of the wax. After a couple of seconds, pull off the cloth strip to remove the wax. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Waxing lasts longer than shaving, but it’s definitely more painful. [22] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Experts don’t advise waxing if you take or use isotretinoin, antibiotics, or tretinoin.

steps.title: Laser removal eliminates leg hair after a few sessions.
steps.content: Laser removal eliminates leg hair after a few sessions. During a treatment, a doctor will target your body hair with lasers. Over several sessions, these lasers will thin out and eventually destroy the hair completely. [23] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Laser hair removal is a good option for permanent hair removal, but it’ll take several sessions to see full results. Laser hair removal can be pretty pricey. A single session may cost almost $300. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Electrolysis permanently removes body hair.
steps.content: Electrolysis permanently removes body hair. During the procedure, electrical probes permanently damage your hair follicles, so no more body hair grows back. [25] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Many clinics charge electrolysis treatments by the hour, or in 15- or 30-minute chunks. [26] X Research source
